Intervention: Arm I:Resection of the sentinel node+Conventional axillary dissection
• Resection of the sentinel node immediately followed by an axillary dissection
Conventional surgery: resection of the sentinel node immediately followed by an axillary dissection.
- Arm II: Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the node
• Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the node and then dissection of the axillary node if the sentinel node is positive.

• Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the sentinel node: Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the node and then dissection of the axillary node if the sentinel node is positive. No axillary dissection for the negative sentinel node.
Eligibility: Invasive breast adenocarcinoma, confirmed by 1 of the following substances:
Histologically confirmed by the biopsy of the nucleus or open
Confirmed by thin needle aspiration cytology AND positive clinical breast examination and ultrasound or mammography
No positive ipsilateral axillary lymph nodes
No prior withdrawal of ipsilateral axillary lymph nodes
No suspicious palpable nodes in the contralateral axel or palpable supraclavicular or infraclavicular nodes, unless biopsy has proven that there is no malignantity.
No ulceration, erythema, infiltration of the underlying skin or chest wall (full fixation), orange skin or skin oedema of any magnitude
The entanglement or extinction of the skin or the inversion of nipples is permitted.
No malignancy or bilateral mass in the opposite breast that is suspected of malignancy, unless biopsy has proven that it is not malignant
No diffuse tumours or multiple malignancies in different breast quadrants
No other prior breast cancer except lobular carcinoma in situ
No prior or concomitant breast implants
No prior illness in the last five years except:
Effective treatment of skin cancer in squamous or basal cell cells
A carcinoma surgically treated in situ from the cervix
A lobular carcinoma treated surgically in situ of the ipsilateral or contralateral breast
No concurrent psychiatric or addictive disorder
No prior immunotherapy for this cancer
No previous chemotherapy for this cancer, including neoadjuvant chemotherapy
No prior hormonal treatment for this cancer
No prior radiation therapy for this cancer
A prior excision biopsy or an authorised lumpectomy
Results: Morbidity - Number of participants with residual shoulder removal deficit
Shoulder Removal Deficiency Definition: The magnitude of shoulder movements decreased by more than or more than 10% from the one measured prior to surgery.
Time limit: Before and after surgery (within 30 days of randomization)
Title of the arm/group: Arm I:Resection of the sentinel node+Conventional axillary dissection
Description of the arm/group: Resection of the sentinel node immediately followed by an axillary dissection
Conventional surgery: resection of the sentinel node immediately followed by an axillary dissection.
Type of measure: Number of participants
Title of the arm/group: Arm II: Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the node
Description of the arm/group: Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the node and then dissection of the axillary node if the sentinel node is positive.

• Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the sentinel node: Resection of the sentinel node followed by examination of the node and then dissection of the axillary node if the sentinel node is positive. No axillary dissection for the negative sentinel node.
Type of measure: Number of participants
Adverse Events: - Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify 1/2788 (0.04%)
- Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify 1/2800 (0.04%)
